meanings.definition: The belief that a society or system should be led by a select group of individuals.
meanings.sent1: In some countries, elitisms can lead to inequality among people.
meanings.sent2: Her elitisms were evident in the way she only associated with people from prestigious backgrounds.
meanings.sent3: The elitisms of the fashion industry sometimes make me chuckle.
meanings.sent4: His elitisms were like a golden crown, shining brightly in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The elitisms of the royal family were as clear as a crystal chandelier.

meanings.definition: Behavior or attitudes that reflect a belief in the superiority of a select group.
meanings.sent1: The elitisms displayed by the group made others feel excluded.
meanings.sent2: His elitisms were evident in the way he looked down on those less fortunate.
meanings.sent3: Sometimes, elitisms can make people act like they are in a secret club.
meanings.sent4: Her elitisms were like a shield, protecting her from criticism.
meanings.sent5: The elitisms of the team were like a bright beacon, guiding their actions.
